dc:title: Dorothy Day Writes From Jail
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Serving a month-long sentence for protesting civil defense drills her letters describe conditions in jail. Says there protest was a refusal to participate in psychological warfare and a way of showing responsibility for the common good.
